content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

entries.title: Adobe Acrobat uses AI to turn your PDFs into podcasts
entries.snippet: Adobe has introduced new generative AI features to its Acrobat software, specifically within the separate Acrobat Studio app, enhancing how users interact with PDF documents. These updates include tools for chat-based editing, and the ability to create personalized podcasts and pitch presentations from PDF content. The "Generate Podcast" feature provides audio summaries of documents—like notes, reports, and transcripts—using a Microsoft GPT model for transcription and a Google voice model, although Adobe may switch to its proprietary models later. Additionally, the "Generate Presentation" feature leverages Adobe Express tools to create visual summaries with editable presentation templates. Users can guide the AI to focus on specific insights in the documents. The Acrobat AI assistant also now supports in-document edits through natural language prompts, enabling actions such as adding signatures, removing or modifying text, and other PDF alterations—similar to features introduced to Adobe Express in 2025.

entries.title: MacSpeech Scribe
Transcribe audio with Google Gemini for free - here's how to do it
entries.snippet: Google Gemini now offers a free tool for transcribing audio files up to 10 minutes long. Users can upload up to 10 audio files at once, provided their combined length doesn't exceed the time limit. Compatible formats include MP3, AAC, and WAV. To begin, users can access Gemini via its website or app, select the upload option, and choose their desired audio file. Once uploaded, a prompt like "transcribe this speech" initiates the process. If an error occurs, retrying usually resolves the issue. Transcriptions are generated quickly, though they may include filler words (e.g., "uhms" and "ahs"). Users can instruct Gemini to clean the transcript by prompting it to remove such filler words. Additionally, Gemini can help summarize the audio or extract key points, making it a versatile tool for various transcription needs.

entries.title: The Gemini app feature you actually wanted is here
entries.snippet:
Google's Gemini app has launched a highly anticipated feature that allows users to upload and process audio files across Android, iOS, and the web. The app now supports MP3, M4A, and WAV formats and automatically transcribes uploaded audio, extracts key points, highlights important quotes or action items, and generates clear summaries. This update caters especially to users looking to convert meetings, lectures, interviews, or voice notes into searchable, organized documents. According to Josh Woodward, VP of Google Labs and Gemini, this was the most requested user feature.

Users can access the feature via the plus menu on mobile or "Upload files" on the web. Audio upload limitations include a cap of 10 files at once with a total duration not exceeding 10 minutes for free users—double the five-minute video limit. Paid users receive higher caps. However, the 10-file per prompt rule still applies universally to all upload types. Despite these boundaries, the generous audio allowances and robust summarization capabilities make this a valuable addition to Gemini’s AI toolset.

entries.title: Plaud Note Pro Launches With a Button for Real-Time Highlights
entries.snippet:
Plaud has launched the Note Pro, a new AI-powered note-taking device designed to simplify capturing and organizing key points from meetings and conversations. The standout feature is a "Press to highlight" button that allows users to mark important moments in real-time, helping the integrated AI prioritize them during transcription. Equipped with four high-precision microphones, the Note Pro can accurately capture audio from up to 16 feet away and differentiate between calls and in-person meetings.

The device offers up to 50 hours of continuous recording on a single charge, making it suitable for extended use without frequent recharging. It pairs with the upcoming Plaud App 3.0, which will bring multimodal input support, smarter insights, improved "Ask Plaud" capabilities, and a new user interface. The Note Pro is now available for pre-order at $179, with shipments expected to begin in October in the US, UK, and select parts of Europe.

v.title: Otter's new AI agent can speak up in meetings
v.snippet:
Otter has introduced a new suite of AI agents aimed at enhancing productivity and support during virtual meetings. The flagship tool, the Otter Meeting Agent, represents a major upgrade from its previous AI chatbot, now featuring voice-activated interaction and the ability to carry out tasks such as answering questions using company data, scheduling meetings, and drafting emails. Initially available for Zoom, support for Microsoft Teams and Google Meet will follow soon.

In addition to the Meeting Agent, Otter unveiled a Sales Agent that offers live coaching during calls to assist in deal closing and complaint handling. This agent is available across all virtual conferencing platforms for enterprise sales clients. Furthermore, the company introduced an autonomous Sales Development Representative (SDR) Agent capable of giving product demos without human assistance. The SDR Agent is currently accessible through their website, with more specialized agents for marketing, recruiting, and other areas planned for release in the future.

entries.title: Take the aTrain. Introducing an Interface for the Accessible Transcription of Interviews
Save $300 on AI caption and transcription platform Joyspace, now $79.99
entries.snippet:
The article promotes a significant discount on a lifetime subscription to Joyspace, an AI-powered captioning and transcription platform, now available for $79.99 (originally $379). Joyspace allows users to automatically generate captions for videos and transcribe recordings or podcasts using AI. With the Essential Plan, subscribers receive 80 minutes of transcription and 160 credits per month, as well as a 45-minute video export limit.

The plan also includes features such as watermark-free video, downloadable transcripts, instant captions, unlimited downloads and templates, and access to B-roll media like images and GIFs. Supporting 35 languages, Joyspace makes it easy to work with multi-lingual content without needing bilingual services. The platform allows customization of captions to match brand aesthetics and offers tools like animated emojis and timing adjustments for readability.

Beyond accessibility for the hearing-impaired, captions support silent viewing and content virality. Joyspace aims to streamline content creation for webinars, podcasts, and videos, helping creators maximize reach and user engagement.

entries.title: Best speech-to-text app of 2025
entries.snippet:
This comprehensive 2025 TechRadar guide ranks the top speech-to-text apps and services designed to simplify converting spoken language into written text across mobile, desktop, and cloud platforms. Speech-to-text tools have moved from niche uses to broader applications in business, education, and everyday productivity. As voice recognition accuracy has greatly improved, many platforms now boast around 99% transcription accuracy.

Key offerings include:

- **Speechmatics**, praised for its multilingual, accent-flexible AI-driven transcription tools.
- **Dragon Professional**, ideal for business use with high accuracy and productivity tools.
- **Otter**, optimized for mobile and collaborative note-taking during meetings.
- **Verbit**, tailored for enterprise and education with hybrid AI and human transcription.
- **Braina Pro**, a PC-based voice assistant offering versatile command and dictation support.
- **Microsoft Azure Speech to Text** and **IBM Watson**, both cloud-native enterprise solutions offering real-time and batch transcription with customizable language models.
- **Dragon Anywhere**, a mobile app delivering professional-grade dictation in the cloud.
- **Amazon Transcribe**, optimized for business use with live and batch processing.

Top free options include Google Gboard, Just Press Record, Speechnotes, and built-in features like Windows Speech Recognition. Additional apps like iTranslate, Voice Notes, and SpeechTexter highlight specialized capabilities for translation, note organization, and social media use. The guide concludes with advising selection based on user needs and testing methodology.
